TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CosmosConfiguration extends System.Object

Docs.summary: This is a configuration class that holds all the properties the CosmosClient requires.

MemberSignature.Value: public CosmosConfiguration (string connectionString);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string connectionString) cil managed
Public Sub New (connectionString As String)
new Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration : string -> Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration

Docs.param: The connection string must contain AccountEndpoint and AccountKey.
Docs.summary: Extracts the account endpoint and key from the connection string.

MemberSignature.Value: public CosmosConfiguration (string accountEndPoint, string accountKey);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string accountEndPoint, string accountKey) cil managed
Public Sub New (accountEndPoint As String, accountKey As String)
new Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration : string * string -> Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration

Docs.param: The Uri to the Cosmos Account. Example: https://{Cosmos Account Name}.documents.azure.com:443/
Docs.summary: Initialize a new CosmosConfiguration class that holds all the properties the CosmosClient requires.
Docs.example: The example below creates a new CosmosConfiguration cosmosConfiguration = new CosmosConfiguration( accountEndPoint: "https://testcosmos.documents.azure.com:443/", accountKey: "SuperSecretKey");

The example below creates a new with a ConsistencyLevel and a list of preferred locations.
CosmosConfiguration cosmosConfiguration = new CosmosConfiguration( accountEndPoint: "https://testcosmos.documents.azure.com:443/", accountKey: "SuperSecretKey") .UseConsistencyLevel(ConsistencyLevel.Strong) .UseCurrentRegion(Region.USEast2, Region.USWest2);

Docs.param: for a list of valid azure regions. This list may not contain the latest azure regions.
Docs.summary: Set the current preferred region
Docs.example:
The example below creates a new with a of preferred region.
CosmosConfiguration cosmosConfiguration = new CosmosConfiguration( accountEndPoint: "https://testcosmos.documents.azure.com:443/", accountKey: "SuperSecretKey") .UseCurrentRegion(CosmosRegion.USEast2);

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration UseThrottlingRetryOptions (TimeSpan maxRetryWaitTimeOnThrottledRequests, int maxRetryAttemptsOnThrottledRequests);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration UseThrottlingRetryOptions(valuetype System.TimeSpan maxRetryWaitTimeOnThrottledRequests, int32 maxRetryAttemptsOnThrottledRequests) cil managed
Public Overridable Function UseThrottlingRetryOptions (maxRetryWaitTimeOnThrottledRequests As TimeSpan, maxRetryAttemptsOnThrottledRequests As Integer) As CosmosConfiguration

abstract member UseThrottlingRetryOptions : TimeSpan * int -> Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration override this.UseThrottlingRetryOptions : TimeSpan * int -> Microsoft.Azure.Cosmos.CosmosConfiguration

Docs.param: The maximum retry time in seconds for the Azure Cosmos DB service. Any interval that is smaller than a second will be ignored.
The number specifies the times retry requests for throttled requests.
Docs.summary: Sets the minimum time to wait between retry and the max number of times to retry on throttled requests.
Docs.para: When a request fails due to a rate limiting error, the service sends back a response that contains a value indicating the client should not retry before the time period has elapsed. This property allows the application to set a maximum wait time for all retry attempts. If the cumulative wait time exceeds the this value, the client will stop retrying and return the error to the application.
For more information, see Handle rate limiting/request rate too large.
